original_table_html:
BRAND REVITALIZATION STRATEGIES
* Refresh old sources of brand equity
* Create new sources of brand equity 		Expand depth and breadth of awareness and usage of brand Increase quantity of consumption (how much) * Identify additional opportunities to use brand in same basic way
* Identify completely new and different ways to use brand
Increase frequency of consumption (how often)
Improve strength, favorability, and uniqueness of brand associations Bolster fading associations * Retain vulnerable customers
* Recapture lost customers
* Identify neglected segments
* Attract new customers
Neutralize negative associations
Create new associations
summary_markdown: This table outlines brand revitalization strategies, organized around two primary approaches: refreshing or creating new sources of brand equity, and expanding brand awareness and usage. The first approach involves improving the strength, favorability, and uniqueness of brand associations by bolstering fading ones, neutralizing negative associations, or creating new ones. The second approach focuses on increasing the quantity and frequency of consumption, achieved by identifying additional or entirely new ways to use the brand. Both strategic paths aim to retain vulnerable customers, recapture lost ones, identify neglected market segments, and attract new customers, ultimately contributing to the overall revitalization of the brand.
